intro: Senecio multidentatus, commonly known as the many-toothed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that are followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Senecio multidentatus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
